column4: I was able to install amarok using synaptic and its looks great!
you are using kubuntu, or you decided to use amarok on top of GNOME?
you like amarok better than whatever the standard GNOME one is?
the first distro of linux i use was mandriva which used KDE and i just got used to amaroK, so I'm used to it
i'm fighting in my head between KDE and GNOME, so I was just curious.
i like gnome so far though, it's very clean
GNOME seems cleaner.  But, KDE has a better API and more applications.  The API being a particularly bitter point because of the whole Mono thing in GNOME.
What do you mean by better API?
As a long time KDE user, you would personally say GNOME is cleaner?
hahaha if by long time you mean about a week, yes
i abandoned linux once, then came to ubuntu, then left again, and am now back
what do you mean KDEs API is better?
KDE is written on the Qt library.  Which bases a lot of its ideas on what is now Apple's Cocoa.  It's very object oriented.
GNOME's GTK API has tons of little parameters for every method call, they don't use default values enough.
